    • Constructor Detail

      • ThisStatementSyntaxAST

        public ThisStatementSyntaxAST()
        This constructor will initialize the statement with the AST-Type "THIS_STATEMENT_AST". This will help to debug problems or check the AST for correct syntax.

    • Method Detail

      • parseAST

        public AbstractSyntaxAST parseAST(AbstractSyntaxAST parentAST,
                                  SyntaxAnalyzer syntaxAnalyzer)
        This method will parse the "this" statement and checks it for the correct syntax. This statement can just be used inside a BlockAST or inside an AbstractExpressionAST. You also can't use the "this" keyword a second time. You need to specify a period after the keyword which is followed by another statement which will call a function or variable.

        An example for this statement:

        var test_string = this.test();

        fun main(args: string[]) { println(this.test()); return 0; }

        fun test() = "Hello World";

        Overrides:
        parseAST in class AbstractStatementSyntaxAST
        Parameters:
        parentAST - The parent of this AST. It can be a BlockAST or an AbstractExpressionAST.
        syntaxAnalyzer - The given SyntaxAnalyzer is used for checking the syntax of the current Token list.
        Returns:
        It will return null if an error occurred or an AbstractStatementAST if it parsed until to the end.
